title: Shaq donates a year's rent to a paralyzed Atlanta boy
text:
Basketball Hall of Famer Shaquille O'Neal has donated a home to an Atlanta woman whose 12-year-old son was shot at a school football game and left paralyzed from the chest down

Basketball Hall of Famer Shaquille O'Neal has donated a home to an Atlanta woman whose 12-year-old son was shot at a school football game and left paralyzed from the chest down.

O'Neal told WXIA-TV that Isaiah Payton's family was living in a one-bedroom apartment that wasn't accessible for people with disabilities, but they now have a home in a good neighborhood. He agreed to furnish the home and pay its rent for the next year.

'I was watching the story and it's just sad,' O'Neal said. 'It could have been any one of us. It could have been my son. It could've been your cousin and she was living in a one-bedroom house with her two boys so we found her a one-bedroom house in College Park. Nice area.'

The media home value in Atlanta's College Park neighborhood is around $154,000, according to Niche.com.

'I'm going to get her some ring cameras on me,' he continued, ostensibly referring to doorbells with pre-installed security cameras. 'We're going to give her some furniture, TVs and pay her rent off for a year and help her get on her feet.'

Isaiah was shot through the spine in August after a football scrimmage between two local schools.

SCROLL DOWN FOR VIDEO

Isaiah Payton was shot at a high school football scrimmage and is now paralyzed from the chest down. The 12-year-old is now moving into a new home that is more accessible

Isaiah's mother, Allison Woods, has said relearning how to care for Isaiah (pictured) meant she had to leave her job, adding financial stress to her emotional turmoil

Sixteen-year-old Damean Spear also was wounded and treated for minor injuries.

Cops in Atlanta arrested a 15-year-old boy on Wednesday, saying the child is connected to the shooting.

Isaiah's mother, Allison Woods, has said relearning how to care for Isaiah meant she had to leave her job, adding financial stress to her emotional turmoil.

Woods has started a GoFundMe page to help pay for her son's medical expenses.

'My son, Isaiah Payton, is an active 12-year-old kid who loves sports such as football and basketball,' she wrote. 'He dreamed of being a football player when he grew up.

'Unfortunately, while attending a high school football game, he was shot twice; in the chest and near his liver. He has been in the hospital for 2 weeks, is currently unable to breath on his own, paralyzed from the chest down, undergoing many tests, and is on a feeding tube.

'Any donation you make will help make a difference towards his treatments and medical bills.'

O'Neal frequently works in Atlanta as an in-studio analyst for TNT's NBA coverage.

In May, Brittany Keith of Douglasville posted a plea for help on Instagram, asking someone to help her buy shoes for her 13-year-old son, Zach, who happens to have size-18 feet

The Paytons are not the first Georgia family to benefit from O'Neal's generosity this year.

In May, Brittany Keith of Douglasville posted a plea for help on Instagram, asking someone to help her buy shoes for her 13-year-old son, Zach, who happens to have size-18 feet.

Zach is a basketball and football player at Stewart Middle School in Douglasville who is already 6 feet 2 inches tall.

No stranger to this problem, O'Neal offered to pay.

He arranged for Brittany and Zach to visit Friedman's Shoes, O'Neal's favorite big-and-tall shoe store in Atlanta, which is owned by Bruce Friedman.

Shaq told CBS 46 reporter Sharon Reed he's bought 3,000 pairs of shoes from Friedman's over the last 30 years ever since the owner gave him a free pair of dress shoes for prom.

NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal arranged for Brittany Keith and her son, Zach, to meet him at Friedman's Shoes (pictured), a big-and-tall shoe store in Atlanta

'Bruce gave me a pair of shoes when I was 18-years-old for free, so I'ma take care of the kid today because somebody did it for me. I'm doing it for the kid,' O'Neal said.

Brittany's said her son didn't know he was going to meet Shaq during their Wednesday store visit.

Shaq poses for pics with CBS 46 reporter Sharon Reed (center) and 13-year-old Zach Keith

'I told him that we were going to go to a shoe store and that we were just going around looking at shoes and seeing if we could afford a pair,' she told CBS 46.

The seemingly-shy Zach looked stunned when he walked into the store and saw Shaq sitting on a shoe bench. He stumbled and looked away momentarily before walking up to the NBA legend and shaking his hand.

'I wasn't expecting that. To meet Shaquille O'Neal, all star player, one of my all star favorites, surprised, shocked,' Zach said.

O'Neal ended up buying Zach 10 pairs of shoes.

'That should last him for a long time,' he said.

Brittany expressed her gratitude on Facebook and Instagram.

'I'm am so overwhelmed with all types of feelings right now. Thanks to everyone who shared my post. You all helped make this happen and kept pushing me to post... Words can't express how I'm feeling,' she said.
description: Basketball Hall of Famer Shaquille O'Neal has donated a home to an Atlanta woman whose 12-year-old son was shot at a school football game and left paralyzed from the chest down.
